instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG? PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG is a power rail that powers the GPU in an S0 working state. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with image issue. It boots up and chimes, but no image to the display or to HDMI. 

<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>: 0v
<SIGNAL>EP3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL>: 0v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL>: 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL>: 0v (resistance check is 16ohm approx on PH2 and 18ohms approx on PH1) but assuming this is due to the <SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_EN</SIGNAL> being 0v

I replaced <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> with no change. (Does this chip have to be from a donor board or can one purchase online (like digi-key) work, as this is what i did)?

Any suggestions

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Post volatges at pins 9 and 28-30 for J9000.
Pins 28-30 must get voltage at least few sec when hear chime.
Then <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> should go high too.
LCD supposed to be connected...

Did you try a known good panel?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
All measurements done with know good display connected

Pin 9: 0v
28-30: 0v (<CHIP>U9000</CHIP> pin2 5v, pin1: 0v).

Had the probe on each pins before applying power to the board for each test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message:
Any short there?

The LCD panel is not detected, so no image...

Pins 28-30 must get voltage (for short time) even without screen connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Bootups but no image, backlight, or HDMI feed.
threads.message: There is no short on any of this pins, Without the screen connected, pins 28-30 is reading 0v. I believe the issue may be due to the enable signal thats reading 0V, but i replaced the GMUX chip already, <CHIP>U9100</CHIP>
